definition: newlyweds
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
to marry/marriage/wedding/to take a wife
swallow (family Hirundinidae)/old variant of 宴[yan4]
variant of 燕[yan4]

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)/surname Yan
variant of 爾|尔[er3]
thus/so/like that/you/thou

sentences.english: That would pave the way for newlywed Odom to start in his place.
sentences.chinese: 那就为新婚燕尔的奥多姆顶替他首发铺平了道路。

sentences.english: Inside the ring there are tinyphotographic portraits of the couple.
sentences.chinese: 戒指上特制了这对新婚燕尔的微型照片。

sentences.english: When a newly married couple smiles, everyone knows why.
sentences.chinese: 当一对新婚燕尔互相微笑，人们都知道为什么。

definition: newly wed
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
reunion after an absence is sweeter than being newlyweds (idiom)/absence makes the heart grow fonder
married couple very much in love/deep conjugal love
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
erhua variant of 小兩口|小两口[xiao3 liang3 kou3]
to bill and coo (idiom)/to whisper sweet nothings to one another/to be very much in love
(coll.) young married couple
to get married
world with only two people (usually refers to a romantic couple)/romantic couple's world
to get married
(of a married woman) to stay home alone
lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
(of a child bride) to consummate marriage
see 月下花前[yue4 xia4 hua1 qian2]
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
